Name: Tax Refund or Credit, Construction Street, Sewer
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing for a commercial rent or occupancy tax refund or credit for lost business revenue caused by extended street and sewer construction, repair or reconstruction in the immediate vicinity of a commercial establishment.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.   Section 11-709 of chapter 7 of title 11 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new subdivision d, to read as follows:
	d.	For those tenants not exempt from the payment of the tax, an applicant for a refund or credit, in an amount of the tax paid or owed for the affected tax year, shall be approved where prolonged disruption of street access, caused by extended street and sewer construction, repair of reconstruction, results in loss of business revenue, provided that:
	(1)	the street or sewer work hindered access to the tenant's street or immediate vicinity for a period exceeding ninety days; and
	(2)	the tenant can document, to the satisfaction of the commissioner, a loss of business revenue in excess of twenty per cent; and
	(3) 	the commissioner certifies that the loss of revenue appears to be directly related to the disruption of street access; and
	(4)	the street or sewer work was part of a capital reconstruction project.
	ï¿½2.	This local law shall take effect immediately and shall apply to all street or sewer construction, repair or reconstruction projects started on or after the effective date of this bill.
